column4: i'm in ubuntu 8.10. i've edited ~/.config/user-dirs.dirs ; the Documents section i've pointed to another folder, set the correct permissions, but when i go to Documents.. it still wants to go to /home/username/Documents .. any ideas?
ever think of doing a symlink instead?
sounds like a kludge though since this config file isn't working :(
i restartd x, but not the whole machine
will it hurt to do a full restart?
okay, still didn't work; any other ideas? i'm gonna rm -rf /home/username/Documents and then ln -s.
I'd backup before I do that though
i have the group set properly
you mean just having the group works ? (i'm sorry)
I would assume... I don't mess with permissions much...
if it doesn't go ahead and set owner
and from there, to 9.10 if you dist upgrade again
